schema.title: vSphere client config secret
schema.description: JSON schema defining vSphere client config in a secret.

host.description: The hostname or IP address of the vSphere server.

port.description: The port number to connect to the vSphere server.

username.description: The username to authenticate with the vSphere server.

password.description: The password to authenticate with the vSphere server.

datacenter_name.description: The name of the datacenter in the vSphere environment.

resource_pool_name.description: The name of the resource pool to use for deployments.

certificate_data.description: The certificate data for secure connections.

auto_placement.description: This field is a boolean flag indicating whether to automatically place the virtual machine on a host.

allow_insecure.description: This field is a boolean flag indicating whether to allow insecure connections to the vSphere server.

schema.title: Secret Value
schema.description: Kubernetes Client Config secret value.

host.description: The hostname or IP address of the server to connect to.

port.description: The port number to use for the connection.

key_file.description: The path to the key file.

cert_file.description: The path to the certificate file.

verify_ssl.description: Whether to verify the server's SSL certificate.

host.description: The hostname or IP address of the server to connect to.

port.description: The port number to use for the connection.

token.description: The authentication token used for bearer authentication.

verify_ssl.description: Whether to verify the server's SSL certificate.

schema.title: Secret Value
schema.description: Storage Array Client Config secret value.

username.description: The username to access the storage array

password.description: The password to access the storage array

schema.title: Secret Value
schema.description: AWS Client Config secret value.

aws_access_key_id.description: The ID of your AWS ACCESS KEY ID.

aws_secret_access_key.description: The ID of your AWS SECRET ACCESS KEY.

region_name.description: The server region name, such as us-east-1. (Not us-east-1b, which is an availability zone, or US East, which is a Region.)

endpoint_url.description: The complete URL to use for the constructed client. Normally, botocore will automatically construct the appropriate URL to use when communicating with a service. You can specify a complete URL (including the "http/https" scheme) to override this behavior. If this value is provided, then ``use_ssl`` is ignored.

api_version.description: The API Version to use, if not latest.

assume_role.description: The role ARN that NativeEdge manager instance is able to assume.

schema.title: Secret Value
schema.description: Azure Client Config secret value.

oneOf.title: Client Secret Authentication
oneOf.description: Authentication using client id and secret.

client_id.description: The application of client ID of a service principal in Azure

client_secret.description: The secret associated with client ID

password.description: The Azure password for the user

additional_options.title: Additional Options
additional_options.description: Additional options that can be specified in Azure client config.

scale_name_separator.description: When scaling resources, this is the separator in the name that will be appended in order that the resource will have a unique name

scale_name_suffix_chars.description: A string of characters to be used when generating unique names during resource scaling

schema.title: Secret Value
schema.description: String List secret value.

schema.title: artifact_configuration_secret_name
schema.description: JSON schema defining artifact storage access config in a secret.

artifact_base_url.description: This URL is used to construct subsequent artifacts URLs. Artifacts location will be concatenated to this base URL to fetch particular artifact, unless user overrides the specific artifact URL input. User must provide this value, without trailing /.

artifact_curl_config.description: Curl command parameters to successfully download artifacts from the external storage.

artifact_download_headers.description: Additional headers to be used when downloading artifacts from the external storage. Example: "X-JFrog-Art-Api: ${{secrets.X_JFROG_ARTIFACTORY_API}}"

artifact_base_url_parameters.description: URL suffix that will be added by default to all artifacts URLs. Used to pass URL embedded parameters such as tokens. If user overrides artifact URL this value will not be used. Example values: ?param1=value ,paramX.

binary_image_url.description: URL from the external storage of the Virtual Machine Image that will be used to create the Virtual Machine.

binary_image_access_user.description: User name of the Repository of the Virtual Machine Image that will be used to create the Virtual Machine.

binary_image_access_token.description: Token to the Repository of the Virtual Machine Image that will be used to create the Virtual Machine.

binary_image_version.description: Version of the Virtual Machine Image that will be used to create the Virtual Machine.

schema.title: SSH Public Key Schema
schema.description: JSON schema defining an SSH public key for secure access.

schema.title: SSH Private Key Schema
schema.description: JSON schema defining an SSH private key for secure access.

schema.title: Litmus MQTT Broker Config
schema.description: JSON schema defining the configuration for an MQTT Broker.

ip.description: The IP address of the MQTT server.

port.description: The port number for the MQTT server.

fqdn.description: The fully qualified domain name of the MQTT server.

ca_cert.description: The CA certificate for the MQTT server.

username.description: The username for accessing the MQTT server.

password.description: The password for accessing the MQTT server.

topic.description: The topic to subscribe to on the MQTT server.

schema.title: Telit MQTT Broker Config
schema.description: JSON schema defining the configuration for an MQTT Broker.

mqtt_broker_ip.description: The IP address of the MQTT server.

mqtt_port.description: The port number for the MQTT server.

mqtt_broker_fqdn.description: The Fully Qualified Domain Name of the MQTT server.

user.description: The username for accessing the MQTT server.

passwd.description: The password for accessing the MQTT server.

ca_cert.description: The CA Certificate for accessing the MQTT server.

client_cert.description: The Client Certificate for accessing the MQTT server.

client_key.description: The Client Key for accessing the MQTT server.

certs_directory.description: Target path on the Virtual Machine for the certificates to be downloaded to.

schema.title: Password Schema
schema.description: JSON schema defining a simple password string.

schema.title: RHEL Subscription Manager Configuration
schema.description: JSON schema defining the configuration for a RHEL Subscription Manager.

username.description: The username for the RHEL Subscription Manager.

password.description: The password for the RHEL Subscription Manager.

org.description: The organization ID for the RHEL Subscription Manager.

activation_key.description: The activation key for the RHEL Subscription Manager.

server_url.description: The server URL for the RHEL Subscription Manager.

baseurl.description: The base URL for the RHEL Subscription Manager.

schema.title: NVIDIA NGC Configuration
schema.description: JSON schema defining the configuration for NVIDIA NGC.

api_key.description: The API key for accessing NVIDIA NGC.

org_name.description: Organization name needed for NGC CLI configuration

team_name.description: Team name needed for NGC CLI configuration

schema.title: Litmus Edge Secret Configuration
schema.description: This schema defines the structure of the secret configuration for Litmus Edge, including the EO user, default password, and the new admin password.

eo_password.description: Default password for the EO system

admin_password.description: New admin password for the EO system

schema.title: Edge Manager Secret Configuration
schema.description: This schema defines the structure of the secret configuration for the Litmus Edge Manager, including user credentials, passwords, and port settings.

admin_default_password.description: Default password for the admin interface

admin_password.description: New password for the admin UI exposed on port

demo_default_password.description: Default password for the demo user

demo_password.description: New password for the demo UI exposed on port

schema.title: twadmin MSSQL User Password Secret
schema.description: The password for the twadmin MSSQL user.

schema.title: DeepNorth Client Secret
schema.description: The DeepNorth Client Secret

schema.title: User Credentials Configuration
schema.description: This schema defines the structure for user credentials in a Linux and Grafana environment, including admin and AI user details.

grafana_user_name.description: Full name of the Grafana user

grafana_user_email.description: Email address of the Grafana user

ai_user_email.description: Email address of the AI user

items.display_name: Claroty CTD and VSRA User Credentials

schema.title: Claroty CTD and VSRA User Credentials Configuration
schema.description: This schema defines the structure for user credentials for Claroty CTD and VSRA systems, including usernames, passwords, and access keys.

password.description: Current password for the CTD user

new_password.description: New password for the CTD user

password.description: Current password for the VSRA user

new_password.description: New password for the VSRA user

sac_access_key.description: Access key for the VSRA system

schema.title: Basic Authentication Credentials Configuration
schema.description: This schema defines the structure for user credentials of basic authentication, including username and password.

schema.title: aveva_artifact_configuration
schema.description: JSON schema defining Aveva artifact configuration.

artifact_base_url.description: This URL is used to construct subsequent artifacts URLs. Artifacts location will be concatenated to this base URL to fetch particular artifact, unless user overrides the specific artifact URL input. User must provide this value, without trailing /.

artifact_download_headers.description: Additional headers to be used when downloading artifacts from the external storage. Example: "X-JFrog-Art-Api: ${{secrets.X_JFROG_ARTIFACTORY_API}}"

artifact_base_url_parameters.description: URL suffix that will be added by default to all artifacts URLs. Used to pass URL embedded parameters such as tokens. If user overrides artifact URL this value will not be used. Example values: ?param1=value ,paramX.

artifact_checksums.description: Collection of checksums for different artifacts.

MEDIA.zip.description: The checksum for the MEDIA.zip artifact.

PsTools.zip.description: the checksum for the PsTools.zip artifact.

binary_image_url.description: URL from the external storage of the Virtual Machine Image that will be used to create the Virtual Machine.

binary_image_access_user.description: User name of the Repository of the Virtual Machine Image that will be used to create the Virtual Machine.

binary_image_access_token.description: Token to the Repository of the Virtual Machine Image that will be used to create the Virtual Machine.

binary_image_version.description: Virtual Machine Image Version that will be used to create the Virtual Machine.

commandcenter_install_url.description: Command Center Install URL value from secret.
